intro: Draba olgae var. chitralensis, commonly known as the Chitral Draba, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
